revised_title: An Account of the Anomalous Epidemic Smallpox in Plymouth, 1724-1725
tldr: This article describes the unique characteristics and symptoms of an anomalous epidemic smallpox outbreak in Plymouth from 1724 to 1725. Dr. Huxham discusses the severity of the disease, its impact on patients, and the challenges in treating it. He also provides insights into the role of weather and environmental factors in the spread of the disease.
